Description: Pottery cup base sherd. Dark slip with added white, red, yellow and orange paint. Design of circles enclosing double axes in band around bottom.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Probably found at el-Haraga, but confused with Kahun material. Kemp & Merrillees 1980, Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt, p. 82 Probably made at Phaistos, Crete. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 117 Probably made at Phaistos, Crete. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 117
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A553)
Kemp & Merrillees 1980 / Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt (Ka.9) (p. 63)
